sen.j: 高津駅（たかつえき）は、京都府綾部市にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）山陰本線の駅である。
sen.e: Takatsu Station is a station on the West Japan Railway (JR West) Sanin Main Line located in Ayabe City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Takatsu Station is a facility on the West Japan Railway (JR West) Sanin Main Line located in Ayabe City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Takatsu Station, located in Ayabe City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Sanin Main Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 山陰本線の駅ではあるが、隣の綾部駅を介して直通してくる舞鶴線の一部列車も利用可能である。
sen.e: Although it is a JR Sanin Main Line station, the station is also used for some of the trains running on the Maizuru Line that come to the station from the adjacent Ayabe Station.
Although it's a JR Sanin Main Line station, the facility is also used for some of the trains running on the Maizuru Line that reach the station from the adjacent Ayabe Station.
Although it's a JR Sanin Main Line station, the facility is also used for some of the trains running on the Maizuru Line that reach the station from the adjacent Ayabe Station.

sen.j: 東急田園都市線にも高津駅 (神奈川県)がある。
sen.e: There is a station named Takatsu Station (Kanagawa Prefecture) on the Tokyu Denen Toshi Line as well.
There is also a station called Takatsu Station (Kanagawa Prefecture) on the Tokyu Denen Toshi Line.
There is also a station called Takatsu Station (Kanagawa Prefecture) on the Tokyu Denen Toshi Line.

sen.j: 1980年代後半までは、普通列車でも時間帯によっては通過する列車があった（これは並河駅や吉富駅 (京都府)、それに淵垣駅も同じであった）。
sen.e: Until the late 1980s, some local trains passed the station without stopping during certain hours (as was also the case with Namikawa, Yoshitomi (Kyoto Prefecture) and Fuchigaki Stations).
Until the late 1980s, some local trains passed the station without stopping during certain hours (as was also the case with the Namikawa, Yoshitomi (Kyoto Prefecture) and Fuchigaki stations).
Until the late 1980s, some local trains passed the station without stopping during certain hours (as was also the case with the Namikawa, Yoshitomi (Kyoto Prefecture) and Fuchigaki stations).

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Structure of the station
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: Takatsu Station is a ground station that has a pair of platforms facing each other with two railroad tracks running in between.
Takatsu Station is a ground station having a pair of platforms facing each other with two railroad tracks running in between.
Takatsu Station is a ground station having a pair of platforms facing each other with two railroad tracks running in between.

sen.j: 無人駅で駅舎はなく、各ホームの綾部寄りから直接に入る形になっている。
sen.e: It is an unmanned station with no station office and passengers enter the platforms directly from the entrances located on the Ayabe side of the station.
It's an unmanned station with no station office; passengers enter the platforms directly from the entrances located on the Ayabe side of the station.
It's an unmanned station with no station office; passengers enter the platforms directly from the entrances located on the Ayabe side of the station.

sen.j: 下りホーム入口近辺の小屋の中に自動券売機が設置されているが、いわゆる食券販売機タイプなので自動改札機には対応していない。
sen.e: There is a ticket vending machine in a box near the entrance to the platform for outbound trains, but it is a paper ticket vending machine and is incapable of issuing tickets for automated ticket gates.

There is a ticket vending machine in a box near the entrance to the platform for outbound trains, but it's a paper-ticket vending machine and is incapable of issuing tickets for automated ticket gates.

There is a ticket vending machine in a box near the entrance to the platform for outbound trains, but it's a paper-ticket vending machine and is incapable of issuing tickets for automated ticket gates.

sen.j: 集落や商業施設は駅から離れており、比較的閑散としている。
sen.e: With residential quarters and commercial facilities located far from the station, the area around the station is relatively quiet.
With residential quarters and commercial facilities located far from the station, the area surrounding the station is relatively quiet.
With residential quarters and commercial facilities located far from the station, the area surrounding the station is relatively quiet.

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約55人である。

History
History

sen.j: 1958年（昭和33年）2月12日 - 日本国有鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: Takatsu Station opened as a Japan National Railway station.
Takatsu Station opened as a Japan National Railway station.
February 12, 1958: Takatsu Station opened as a station of Japan National Railways.
sen.cmt: 日付を追加しました。Japan National Railways としました。

sen.j: 旅客営業のみ。
sen.e: It is used for passenger service only.
It's used for passenger service only.
It's used for passenger service only.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化によりJR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: The station became a JR West station as a result of the split and privatization of the Japan National Railway Company,
The station became a JR West facility as a result of the split and privatization of the Japan National Railway Company.
April 1, 1987: The station became a JR West facility as a result of the split and privatization of the Japan National Railways.
sen.cmt: 日付を追加しました。Japan National Railways としました。
